(Revise.)13th November, 1944.WAR CABINET.CIVIL AIR TRANSPORT.Minute by the Prime Minister.THE attached telegram has been received from the Minister for CivilAviation at Chicago, stating that he will have to ask for instructions at short notice on questions arising out of the Conference.2. A Cabinet Committee is accordingly appointed comprising : The Lord Privy Seal (Chairman),The Secretary of State for Dominion Affairs,The Secretary of State for Air,The Minister of Aircraft Production,The Minister of War Transport,The President of the Board of Trade,The Minister of State,to consider from day to day questions arising out of the Chicago Conference,referring to the War Cabinet as and when necessary.(Initialled) W. S. C.10, Downing Street, S.W.1,13th November, 1944.[2853G][P.T.O. ANNEX.Copy of a Telegram from the British Delegation, Chicago (Civil AviationConference), to the Foreign Office..(No. 13. Top Secret.) 3rd November, 1944.PERSONAL for Prime Minister from Lord Swinton : "I shall almost certainly be asking for important decisions at short notice. See, for example, issues raised in my telegram No. 12.2. May I suggest that Cabinet Committee should be appointed, whichcould deal expeditiously with questions I refer home?"
